document_data.mainbody:
Finara was a spellscar pilgrim. In , she joined Raidon Kane and Hadyn in a pilgrimage to the Spellscarred land near Ormpetarr after Hadyns death, she backed down, and became both a member of the Order of Blue Fire and an innkeeper.
In , she was gray-haired. By , she was elderly.
Finara was initially resolute to learn the ways of magic again after the collapse of the Weave, or die trying. However, confronted with a dying comrade, she chose to limit the risks.
Finara had been a mage before the Spellplague.
Before the Spellplague, Finara had a tower. Afterwards, by , she owned a burro by the time she arrived at Ormpetarr.
By , Finara was the owner of Finaras, an inn in Ormpetarr, and a fringe member of the Order of Blue Fire.
Before the Spellplague, Finara had been a mage, living in a tower she proved unable to grasp the new make of spells after the Spellplague. Determined to regain her magic or die trying, she headed for Ormpetarr, looking to acquire a spellscar of her own. There, she joined Hadyn and Raidon Kane at some point in  in a trip into the Spellscarred Land, where she brought her burro.
They followed the Pilgrims Path across the Granite Vortex, deciding to cross the bridge that led through it. When Hadyn was slain by the spellscarred land, she decided not to finish the trip, and went back with her burro only Raidon Kane persevered. By , she had made it back to Ormpetarr, where she opened an inn, Finaras.
